titlestmt.titleproper: An Inventory of the Andrew Meier papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Supriya Wronkiewicz.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-23T16:41-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The collection primarily consists of research materials for Andrew Meier's book The Lost Spy: An American in Stalin's Secret Service (New York, 2008). This research material includes correspondence and notes; photocopies of correspondence and of genealogical and biographical data; photocopies of investigative, consular and other government documents; and printed matter. The bulk of the research materials directly relate to Soviet espionage in the United States and elsewhere, and especially to the case of Isaiah Oggins.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Andrew Meier papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.p: David Dallin papers, Hoover Institution Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note

chronitem.event: B.A. (M.A.), Russian Language and Literature, Oxford University
Contributor to periodicals, including Harper's, New Republic, New York Times Magazine, National Geographic, Orion, Outside, Washington Post, Wired, and Time
Contributor, Pacific News Service, San Francisco, California
Fellow, Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars, Washington, D.C.
Writer in residence, Assistant Professor at Eugene Lang College, New York, New York
Author, Black Earth: A Journey through Russia after the Fall (New York: W.W. Norton)
Author, Chechnya: To the Heart of a Conflict (contains excerpts from Black Earth) (New York: W.W. Norton)
Author, The Lost Spy: An American in Stalin's Secret Service (New York: W.W. Norton)

bioghist.p: Honors include Mrs. Giles Whiting Foundation Fellow; Dorothy & Lewis B. Cullman Center for Writers & Scholars at the New York Public Library; National Endowment for the Humanities Fellow; Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars; Alicia Patterson Foundation Fellow
Contemporary Authors Online, Gale, 2010. Reproduced in Biography Resource Center. Farmington Hills, Mich.: Gale, 2010. http://galenet.galegroup.com/servlet/BioRC
"Andrew Meier - Assistant Professor" Eugene Lang College Faculty. The New School for Liberal Arts. n.d. Web. 24 August 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection primarily consists of research materials for Andrew Meier's book The Lost Spy: An American in Stalin's Secret Service (New York, 2008). This research material includes correspondence and notes; photocopies of correspondence and of genealogical and biographical data; photocopies of investigative, consular and other government documents; and printed matter. The bulk of the research materials directly relate to Soviet espionage in the United States and elsewhere, and especially to the case of Isaiah Oggins.

Materials of note in the collection include the detailed genealogical and biographical data Meier compiled regarding Isaiah Oggins and his family ( Oggins family related materials ) as well as Meier's detailed research on Oggins' contemporaries and incidents relating to the Communist Party in the United States. The original order of the materials has been maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of Meier's research specifically pertaining to Isaiah Oggins, his family, and colleagues as well as correspondence between Meier and Oggins' son Robin and Robin's correspondence regarding Isaiah. Arranged as follows: Correspondence, Family documents, and Clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letters to Meier and Robin Oggins related to Freedom of Information Act requests regarding his father

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence to Meier and Robin Oggins's correspondence related to Freedom of Information Act requests regarding his father

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also includes Meier's notes and related correspondence
